thread.title: Jose Bautista hits game-tying home run after FOX graphic showing Royals in World Series
thread.title_full: Jose Bautista hits game-tying home run after FOX graphic showing Royals in World Series

author: Gordon Dixon
title: Jose Bautista hits game-tying home run after FOX graphic showing Royals in World Series
text:
Jose Bautista hits game-tying home run after FOX graphic showing Royals in World Series October 23, 2015 0 0 
During the bottom of the seventh inning of Game 6 of the American League Championship Series, the Royals held a 3-1 lead over the Blue Jays. Toronto, of course, still had the eighth and ninth innings to tie the game or take the lead and avoid elimination. However, the above graphic was shown, which prematurely put Kansas City in the World Series against the Mets. 
Perhaps fittingly, Jose Bautista came up to bat in the top of the eighth inning with Ben Revere on first base and hit a home run to tie the ball game. 
Your browser does not support iframes. 
Shortly after, rain began to fall forcing the grounds crew to bring out the tarp. During the delay, Joe Buck issued an apology on behalf of FOX. By that point, the damage was already done and not many people had much interest in hearing what Buck had to say. That was one lame ass apology by Joe Buck. #BlueJays #ComeTogether 
â€” Andreas Papadopoulos (@APLawToronto) October 24, 2015 @FS1 #joebuck come on man. Your apology is weak and too late
